security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It provides guidance and examples for using the cryptofeed Python library, a legitimate open-source project for cryptocurrency data feeds. No network calls, file system access, or command execution in the skill files themselves.

content.user_title: Build crypto trading systems with real-time exchange data
content.value_statement: Building cryptocurrency trading systems requires connecting to 40+ exchange APIs with normalized data formats. This skill provides code examples, setup patterns, and best practices for using the cryptofeed library to stream WebSocket data for trades, order books, and tickers.
actual_capabilities: Connect to 40+ cryptocurrency exchanges via WebSocket
Subscribe to real-time trades, order books, and ticker data
Implement normalized data handling across all exchanges
Create NBBO feeds for cross-exchange arbitrage
Handle authenticated private channels and REST endpoints
limitations: Requires Python 3.8+ environment for the cryptofeed library
Does not execute trades or manage API credentials directly
No built-in strategy implementation - you must write your own
Exchange connectivity depends on exchange API availability

use_cases.title: Build real-time trading systems
use_cases.description: Stream live market data and implement automated trading strategies across multiple exchanges

use_cases.title: Collect market data pipelines
use_cases.description: Build reliable data pipelines that capture trades and order book updates for analysis

use_cases.title: Analyze cross-exchange data
use_cases.description: Aggregate best bid/offer data across exchanges to identify arbitrage opportunities

prompt_templates.title: Get started with cryptofeed
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up cryptofeed to receive real-time Bitcoin price data from Coinbase. Show me the basic FeedHandler setup and callback pattern.

prompt_templates.title: Monitor multiple exchanges
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Python script that connects to Binance, Coinbase, and Kraken simultaneously to stream BTC-USDT ticker updates and compare prices.

prompt_templates.title: Build order book tracker
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to subscribe to L2 order book updates for multiple trading pairs and handle the normalized book data structure.

prompt_templates.title: Implement NBBO aggregation
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a National Best Bid/Offer feed that aggregates data from three exchanges to find the best prices for a trading pair.

output_examples.input: Set up cryptofeed to stream Bitcoin trades from Coinbase
output: Import FeedHandler, Coinbase exchange, and TRADES channel
Define a callback function to receive trade data
Create FeedHandler and add Coinbase feed subscription
The callback receives normalized Trade objects with exchange, symbol, side, amount, price, and timestamp

best_practices: Use callbacks for processing data to avoid blocking the feed handler
Implement reconnection logic for production trading systems
Start with single exchange connections before adding multiple feeds
anti_patterns: Blocking operations in callbacks - use async handlers for production
Hardcoding API credentials in callback functions
Skipping symbol validation when subscribing to multiple exchanges

faq.question: Which Python versions are supported?
faq.answer: Cryptofeed requires Python 3.8 or higher. It works with Python 3.8, 3.9, 3.10, 3.11, and 3.12.

faq.question: What exchanges are supported?
faq.answer: Over 40 exchanges including Binance, Coinbase, Kraken, Bitfinex, Bybit, OKX, KuCoin, Deribit, BitMEX, and many more.

faq.question: Does cryptofeed execute trades?
faq.answer: No, cryptofeed is for data collection only. You need separate code to execute trades using exchange API credentials.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this library?
faq.answer: Cryptofeed is an open-source library. Private data only flows if you configure authenticated channels with your API keys.

faq.question: Why am I not receiving data?
faq.answer: Check exchange API status, verify symbol names match exchange format, ensure WebSocket connection is established, and check your callback implementation.

faq.question: How is cryptofeed different from CCXT?
faq.answer: CCXT focuses on REST API trading. Cryptofeed specializes in WebSocket streaming for real-time data with normalized formats across exchanges.
